arch:Archive.foaf:name: University of Montana, Mansfield Library, Archives and Special Collections
arch:Archive.nwda:facsimile: The use of digital cameras is permitted with most materials. All photocopying is performed by staff. We reserve the right to limit the number of copies made; to restrict the use of rare and valuable items; and to deny a request because of copyright regulations, privacy rights, donor-imposed regulations, or other rights-related issues. To see our reproduction prices or to order reproductions please check this webpage http://www.lib.umt.edu/asc/reproductions or contact Archives and Special Collections http://www.lib.umt.edu/asc/contact.
arch:Archive.dcterms:description: The University of Montana’s Archives and Special Collections holds university records and publications, manuscript collections, regional and historic maps, oral histories and other sound recordings, still and moving image materials, pamphlets, ephemera, architectural drawings and a small number of artifacts. The majority of the department’s materials help to document the people and activities of the University of Montana, Western Montana, and the region, but our collections also include a number of non-Montana rare and valuable books. Some manuscript collections, including the papers of Montana’s US Senators and Representatives, have national and international scope.
